name: 6.2 " 'I' On Sports" Online Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who came to Cheers to ask Sam to do sports on TV?
questions.explanation:
Dave Richards.

	Dave had to give up his job and wanted Sam to replace him. It was only supposed to be for the weekend. Dave told him it might turn out to be a permanent gig for him.

questions.text: What did Rebecca call Sam's friend?
questions.explanation:
The biggest jerk on Earth.

	Dave was hitting on Rebecca relentlessly. Rebecca asked him if he had the time, when he said yes and gave the time she said "Good, 'cause I just wanted to remember the exact moment I met the biggest jerk on Earth."

questions.text: What lie did Sam tell to leave work early?
options: He just found out his girlfriend was in labor.
questions.explanation:
His apartment was robbed.

	Sam had Woody call the bar from the pay phone. Sam then pretended it was a call for him saying his house was robbed.

questions.text: What channel did Sam do the sports for?
questions.explanation:
13.

	Earlier Woody said Dave was a big star from channel 10. Dave corrected him and said it was channel 13.

questions.text: What was Sam's first commentary about?
options: his old days as a relief pitcher for the Red Sox
questions.explanation:
rooting for the home team.

	The gang was all watching him on the TV and didn't think he was very good. Carla was the one who told him he wasn't that great.

questions.text: What did Carla compare Sam's delivery of the sports to?
questions.explanation:
watching old people eat.

	She told him he delivered the sports fine, but needed to come up with more interesting topics to talk about. Sam thought he had a good idea with his next topic.

questions.text: What was Sam's second commentary about?
questions.explanation:
real vs artificial grass.

	Rebecca knew why Sam had left the bar but did not fire him. She figured he'd either make it big and leave Cheers, or come back a broken man. She said "Either way, I win."

questions.text: Whose name was Norm impressed Sam can say?
questions.explanation:
Martina Navratilova.

	Martina Navratilova was a tennis player from the former Czechoslovakia. Norm was impressed because her name is hard to pronounce and Sam got it on the first try.

groin injury.

	No one could believe that Sam was trying to rap on TV. It was just one more gimmick that Sam tried to be a good sports reporter that didn't work.

questions.text: What did Sam use in his final commentary?
questions.explanation:
a dummy.

	His dummy was little Sammy. The dummy insulted him by saying "your lips are moving". Sam was not asked to return to do anymore sports reporting. He went back to Cheers where he realized he was good bartender and that's where he should be.
